bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

div1.p: Jones appeals for necessary funds to complete restoration of Walter Reed's birthplace.

div1.head: Press Release, August 19, [1927]
div1.p:
J. L. Kibler,
P. O. Box 470,
Newport News, Va.

Newport News, Aug. 19.-- Dr. Clarence Porter Jones, Secretary and Treasurer of the Walter
Reed Memorial Commission, who has charge of the Restoration of BELROI, thee birthplace of
Dr. Reed, in Gloucester County, Va. which work is about completed on the cottage itself,
has issued a public “appeal” for necessary funds to complete the work in its entirety. A
fence is to be erected around the one acre of ground and the premises properly land-scaped
to make it as inviting as possible. A crepe myrtle tree that grew here when Dr. Reed
was born still stands near the front door of the humble cottage. The land purchased from
Mr. George Stubbs, cost $1,000; and to put the whole property in permanent “restoration”
will cost $3,000.
